reviews.review: Игра топ

One of the best games ever made. Half life Is a series about innovation, and even after 16 years, this game is still a beacon of that. It offers fun physics puzzles, a ton of fun gun sections, and a wide variety of environments. 

A must play to anyone who has an account on steam.
Esencial

There are some games where one play through is good enough. Maybe two for games like Amnesia: The Dark Descent. But Half Life 2?

Lets just say use the restroom, get a snack and a drink, and keep your computer plugged in. You'll get completely immersed in the world Valve has created from the intriguing speeches of notorious Dr. Breen, to the chilling atmosphere of Ravenholm. You'll be invested in the story, and when it finishes, you will stare at your computer screen, your eyes telling you it's over, but your soul wishing for it to go on. You'll be longing for more. So you will play it again, and again, and again. You'll find new details you missed the first time, enjoy new dialogue you didn't know you could find, and relish every exploit as you try to beat the game faster than before. You'll eventually mess with the dev console, you'll find alternative endings (kinda?), you'll go on rampages, you'll mess around with physics, but still the game will be just as much fun. I am playing through it for the last time sadly. Mac is dropping support for the 32 bit gaming platforms in favor of 64 bit. This game has been such a facet of life. I seem to always go back to it for more bullet storm fun. I will hold off updating to Catalina until I get my fill of the game again.

If you are still reading this, 1: why are you still debating? Buy the game. It's fantastic. 2: If you are a scared person, if you don't do well with horror at all, Ravenholm will be unpleasant for you, but I URGE you to play it through. It becomes less scary with time, although it never fails to give me the creeps. It is my favorite chapter of the game by far, as it is with many who have fell in love with this game. Eventually I expect it to upgrade to 64 bit, I doubt the community is at all willing to leave this classic behind. I know I'm not.

As someone who has never played a Half-Life game before, i must admit i don't know everything about this game or the community or how to best play it. But this game was amazing, the gameplay, story, and weapons all feel tight and well put together. The graphics are a bit old but hey the game cam out in what, 2007? I would highly suggest this game to anyone who has never played it.   Two things you need to know before playing it is that is #1) check all corners for doors as they are sometimes in weird places and you have to figure out where to go by yourself.
#2) Play Half-Life 2 first, then play Episode 1 and Episode 2 afterwards.   Half-Life 2 is technically just Episode 0.

Esse jogo é MAJESTOSO. Cara, namoral, melhor que muitos dos jogos que têm sido lançados nos últimos anos. Me deixou sem palavras. Lembrar que ele foi lançado em 2004 só me deixa mais impressionado. É um dos jogos que não me arrependo de ter demorado pra jogar, porque se não eu teria que me juntar ao clube de espera de 12 anos por alguma notícia de HL3 (que agora já é basicamente confirmado). Mesmo jogando 16 anos após o lançamento, ainda é completamente jogável, tem pouquíssimos bugs e não enjoa, diferente do primeiro, que tentar jogar hoje em dia é quase que suicídio para algumas pessoas.

Played this game many times before this account and also on consoles. One of the greatest shooters, and games of all time. There is no objective icon or "follow character" and there are no cut-scenes in the game. The story is all told through in game models and animation. The graphics hold up well for being as old a game as it is. The level of polish to the physics, combat, AI and puzzles make this a beacon of inspiration for many in the gaming industry and more fun than many of the games releasing today. I have replayed this game may times and it is one of my all time favorites.

I wrote a review for this before, but it was really short and stupid. 
HL2 was technologically incredible when it first came out, but even more than 10 years later it still holds up as one of the most solid and quintessential shooters ever. Half life 2 is one of those games where if you are open minded enough and willing to commit to enjoying it, will stay with you forever.
If you play a lot of old games, you can make the comparison between this and games released before it and see what everyone at the time was so excited about, but even now in the 2020s, the game still holds up as a masterpiece of a shooter. It's fast, it's fun, it's got an incredibly unique vibe and story that isn't shoved down your throat (in fact you kind of have to look for it if you want it). Graphics don't hold up incredibly, but half life 2 update does make it look a lot prettier. Source uses an old method of ray tracing, and even though it kind of looks shite by today's standards, occasionally I catch myself looking at some random area of the game and my ape brain from 2004 will be amazed by it just for a second.

More than that, the community is one of the greatest and most consistently active gaming communities there has ever been. The source engine spawned countless works of art and multiplayer beasts, like Team Fortress Two, the Portal series, Titanfall, Apex Legends, Counter Strike Source and CS:GO, GMod, and many more. The modding community just will not die no matter how little maintenance valve does on Hammer, and even once you finish the main game there are a million more things to do with HL2 afterwords. It's a huge and very lively community with a lot, no probably the most, content that a game has every produced.
One of, if not the best game ever made. Please play it.

Fantastic. Original Half Life but better. I don't remember the original being so brutal on hard difficulty but I loved it! We need more of the series! Let's go Valve!
its just good, its gameplay still holds up today and is very entertaining.

Tras pasarlo por completo, puedo decir que Half Life 2 a 16 años de su lanzamiento sigue siendo una buena opción para entretenerse y disfrutar de lo que Valve nos "tiene" acostumbrado; innovación y joyas jugabilisticas. No por nada ganó el GOTY ese año. Respecto a la historia, sigue el curso del título anterior bien desarrollado, sin embargo, el final no a todos les gustará debido a que no cierra majestuosamente como el HL. Muestra una mejora gráfica y presenta pocos bugs, casi imperceptibles... Recomiendo que lo adquieran en las ofertas que hace Steam, suele bajar hasta el 75% - 80% del precio.

1998. HALF-LIFE sends a shock through the game industry with its combination of pounding action and continuous, immersive storytelling. Valve's debut title wins more than 50 game-of-the-year awards on its way to being named "Best PC Game Ever" by PC Gamer, and launches a franchise with more than eight million retail units sold worldwide.

NOW. By taking the suspense, challenge and visceral charge of the original, and adding startling new realism and responsiveness, Half-Life 2 opens the door to a world where the player's presence affects everything around them, from the physical environment to the behaviors even the emotions of both friends and enemies.

The player again picks up the crowbar of research scientist Gordon Freeman, who finds himself on an alien-infested Earth being picked to the bone, its resources depleted, its populace dwindling. Freeman is thrust into the unenviable role of rescuing the world from the wrong he unleashed back at Black Mesa. And a lot of people he cares about are counting on him.

The intense, real-time gameplay of Half-Life 2 is made possible only by Source®, Valve's new proprietary engine technology. Source provides major enhancements in:

Characters: Advanced facial animation system delivers the most sophisticated in-game characters ever seen. With 40 distinct facial "muscles," human characters convey the full array of human emotion, and respond to the player with fluidity and intelligence.
Physics: From pebbles to water to 2-ton trucks respond as expected, as they obey the laws of mass, friction, gravity, and buoyancy.
Graphics: Source's shader-based renderer, like the one used at Pixar to create movies such as Toy Story® and Monster's, Inc.®, creates the most beautiful and realistic environments ever seen in a video game.
AI: Neither friends nor enemies charge blindly into the fray. They can assess threats, navigate tricky terrain, and fashion weapons from whatever is at hand.
